title: Battlestar Galactica Extras Fanedits TV Specials x265
description:
Battlestar.Galactica.Extras.Fanedits.TVSpecials.x265

THIS TORRENT USES X265 HEVC (High Efficiency Video Coding) VIDEO
PLEASE USE A PLAYER THAT SUPPORTS X265 HEVC VIDEO LIKE VLC, POTPLAYER, ETC

EXTRAS: 27 MKV FILES WITH A TOTAL OF 82 BLURAY AND DVD EXTRAS 
FANEDITS: 10 FANEDITS BASED ON BSG 2003-2009
TV SPECIALS: 7 TV SPECIALS ABOUT BSG 2003-2009
SEE THE NFO IN EACH COLLECTION FOLDER FOR DETAILS

Battlestar Galactica BluRay DVD Extras x265: 8hour 42min 28sec 3,045,009,034bytes

video: 19x 480p crf=19.00to21.50 (video ~408Kbps to ~694Kbps)
video: 4x 720p crf=19.00to22.50 (video ~814Kbps to ~882Kbps)
video: 4x 1080p crf=24.25to27.00 (video ~1804Kbps to ~2480Kbps)
audio: 25x 2-channel HE-AAC 96Kbps AND 2x 6-channel HE-AAC 224Kbps

Battlestar Galactica Fanedits x265: 2hour 04min 41sec 1,766,393,100bytes
Handbrake x64 0.10.3 20160122 x265 HEVC
video: 1x 480p crf=20.00 preset=veryslow (video ~674Kbps)
video: 9x 1080p crf=23.00to26.00 preset=medium (video ~1072Kbps to ~2328Kbps)
audio: 3x 2-channel HE-AAC 96Kbps AND 7x 6-channel HE-AAC 256Kbps

Battlestar Galactica TV Specials x265: 3hour 11min 29sec 1,376,600,691bytes
Handbrake x64 0.10.3 20160122 x265 HEVC preset=medium
video: 2x 480p crf=21.50 (video ~429Kbps to ~483Kbps)
video: 5x 720p crf=22.25 (video ~749Kbps to ~931Kbps)
audio: 4x 2-channel HE-AAC 96Kbps AND 3x 6-channel HE-AAC 224Kbps

This is an x265 HEVC video, HE-AAC audio encode of the Extras, Fanedits, and TV Specials about the new Battlestar Galactica (2003-2009).

Features of these collections include:

* The best balance of quality and size using the latest x265 HEVC video and HE-AAC audio encoding.

* Complete and consistent naming that includes the season#, disc#, file type, title, and a/v details.

* Any framing of the Extras or TV Specials, aka "black bars", were removed so the picture reached the top/bottom and/or left/right screen edges.

* If the source had subtitles or 5.1 surround sound, the encode included these features.

The file names are structured like this:
BSG.season[#]-[disc#].[source].[type#].[title].[resolution].[audio].[#-of-subs].x265

BSG: Battlestar Galactica (2003-2009)
zBAC: Battlestar Galactica Blood & Chrome (2012)
zPRT: Portlandia (2012)

season0-0: The Mini-Series "Night"
season4-0: The TV movie "Razor"
season5-0: The TV movie "The Plan"

brd-us: Blu-Ray from the US aka the "silver box"
brd-jp: Blu-Ray from Japan
dvd-us: NTSC DVD from the US
dvd-uk: PAL DVD from the UK
dvd-bb: NTSC DVD exclusive Razor Bonus DVD from Best Buy
webcap: An encode from the web sourced from cable TV or streaming websites

Specials also have extra data appended to the file name:
.[date-broadcast].[viewing-order-position]
e.g.: s3e00 is just before s3e01 and s4e10-5 is just before s4e11
Also, the specials don't have "-[disc#]" in their name
